#Text=Scicli
#Text=Scicli ( pronounced like sheekly ) is a small town among the Iblei hills in the Ragusa province on the southeast of Sicily .
#Text=It is one of the " Late Baroque Towns of the Val di Noto " listed on the UNESCO World Heritage List .

column1: #Text=Understand
#Text=The town sits in a valley at the confluence of the Fiume Irmino and three other rivers ( which , however , dry out in the summer ) .
#Text=The town is within 10 km from the small sea-side villages of Plaja Grande , Donnalucata , Cava D'Aliga and Sampieri .
#Text=Scicli was heavily damaged by an earthquake in 1693 and was rebuilt in the style of the Sicilian Baroque , leading to many of its architectural attractions .
#Text=Tourist information
#Text=Servizio Cultura e Turismo , Via Francesco Mormina Penna ( Palazzo Spadaro 1st floor
#Text=) , ☏ +390932839611 , ✉ turismo@comune.scicli.rg.it .
#Text=By plane
#Text=The Catania airport is the nearest international airport , and AST buses can be taken to reach most destinations .
#Text=The Comiso Airport has been modernized and converted for civilian use .
#Text=It is provided as an alternate airport in the event the Catania airport has to cease operations because of volcanic activity .
#Text=By train
#Text=Scicli Station .
#Text=Scicli is on the Siracusa-Ragusa line , connections to Syracuse , Canicatti , Scigli , Modica , and Gela .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Bus connections are served by the Azienda Siciliana Trasporti ( AST ) in the south of the province of Ragusa , and especially towards Modica .
#Text=By car
#Text=From the A18 Messina - Syracuse ( which ends at Rosolini ) , Scicli can be reached via SS115 which makes a sharp turn into Ispica and heads toward Modica .
#Text=From the SS115 , getting to Scicli is best achieved by taking the SP42 .
#Text=If coming directly from the city center of Modica , the SP54 can be used .
#Text=A star-shaped network of provincial roads connect Scicli with the environment ; you can take the SP40 from Sampieri and SP39 from Donnalucata on the coast .
#Text=On foot
#Text=Scicli is a small town and most places are within walking distance ( less than 3 km ) of one another .
#Text=The terrain can be quite steep , so good walking shoes are recommended .
#Text=By bus
#Text=There area is served by the AST bus system .
#Text=There are not many bus stops in the town .
#Text=Churches
#Text=Chiesa di San Giovanni Evangelista ( Church of Saint John the Evangelist ) .
#Text=This church stood next to a Benedictine Monastery , whose place in the early 20th century was taken by the Palazzo Municipale .
#Text=The church was built sometime between 1760 and 1765 .
#Text=It has a concave-convex baroque façade with three levels and a large , oval dome with stained glass windows .
#Text=The interior walls and ceiling are covered in paintings and stucco reliefs .
#Text=Chiesa di San Matteo , Via S. Matteo , 9 .
#Text=Chiesa rupestre del Rosario ( Chiesa della Madonna di Monserrato ) .
#Text=This " cave " church was built around 1516 on the hill Monte Campagna that overlooks the city .
#Text=A statue of the Madonna is here and has numerous healings attributed to it .
#Text=Chiesa S. Maria la Nova , ☏ +393314000858 .
#Text=Bell tower visits by an appointment .
#Text=Chiesa di Santa Maria della Consolazione .
#Text=Chiesa Santa Teresa .
#Text=An interesting former church with a rectangular façade ( 17th-18th centuries ) .
#Text=Complesso della Croce ( ex Convento della Croce ) .
#Text=An austere late Gothic convent which survived the earthquake of 1693 .
#Text=Now it belongs to the state .
#Text=Palazzi
#Text=Palazzo Beneventano .
#Text=This is an excellent example of the Baroque style in Scicli .
#Text=This palace features interesting gargoyles on the balcony lintels .
#Text=Palazzo Spadaro , via F.M.Penna , 34 .
#Text=Summer : 10:00 - 24:00 .
#Text=Built in 17th-18th centuries .
#Text=The Pinacoteca comunale , which occupies the building , has a collection consists of works by artists of the Gruppo di Scicli .
#Text=Palazzo Fava .
#Text=One of the first and largest Baroque palaces in the town .
#Text=Its 18th-century façade is richly decorated .
#Text=Palazzo Veneziano-Sgarlata .
#Text=Palazzo Bonelli ( Patanè ) , via F.M.Penna .
#Text=Palazzo Palle ( Palazzo Municipio ) .
#Text=Built at the beginning of the 20th century .
#Text=Other sites
#Text=Chiafura .
#Text=This is an ancient neighborhood , now an archaeological park , that was carved into the rock .
#Text=In ancient times the area was used as a cemetery .
#Text=It was gradually transformed into a settlement in the early medieval period , coinciding with the Arab conquest , and was occupied without interruption until the middle of the tenth century .
#Text=Villa Penna .
#Text=A former private garden of the Barons of Penna .
#Text=It 's now a well kept villa comunale worth for a break in a hot day .
#Text=At the topmost terraces on the west there is a Capuchin monastery .
#Text=Do
#Text=The Festa delle Milizie .
#Text=This event commemorates the dispute between the Saracens and Christians ( the Normans ) in 1091 .

#Text=It takes place in the last week of May and celebrates the intervention of the Madonna delle Milizie ( Virgin Mary , literally translated as the Madonna of the Militia ) on behalf of the Christians .
#Text=The events are replayed as an open air game and the week finishes with religious services .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Pasticceria Basile , viale I Maggio n. 3 , ☏ +393336785876 .
#Text=This bakery has been in business since 1966 .
#Text=They offer an assortment of pastries in addition to chocolates , candy , and local honey .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Novacento , Via Duprè , 11 .
#Text=This palace has been converted into a hotel .
#Text=The interior is clean and bright .
#Text=This hotel has free breakfast , a restaurant , and a café with outdoor seating .
#Text=Car parking is offered and bike rentals are available .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Modica
#Text=Noto
